name: Combat Features Blur
effect: Attacks and Moves targeting you that don’t require an Accuracy Check now require one, as though they had Accuracy Check of 2. You may only apply half of your Evasion to these Attacks and Moves.

name: Defender
effect: Using the Intercept Maneuvers requires only a

name: Signature Move
effect: Choose a Move you know. Increase the Move’s

name: Walk It Off
effect: Remove one Injury from yourself and regain 1/4th of your maximum Hit Points. This Injury removal doesn’t count against the natural healing limit on

name: Psionic Sight
effect: You are able to visibly see any Psychic Residue left on Humans or Pokémon due to the effects of Psionic abilities. Each Human or Pokémon leaves distinct

name: Ace Trainer
trigger: You spend at least half an hour training your Pokémon
effect: For each Pokémon that has been trained during this time, choose a Stat besides HP; that Stat becomes

name: Critical Moment
effect: The bonuses from your Pokemon’s [Training] are tripled until the end of your next turn.

name: Mobilize
effect: The target cannot provoke Attacks of Opportunity on their next turn. Mobilize may target an Ally only once per encounter.

name: Coordinator
prerequisites: Grace, Novice Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
effect: Your Pokémon may reroll a single Appeal Roll or Damage Roll. This Ability may be used only once per

name: Decisive Director
effect: Add or subtract X from the target’s Initiative until the end of your next turn. X is equal to your Charm

name: Hobbyist
effect: You gain three Skill Edges for which you qualify.

name: Mentor
prerequisites: Two of Charm, Intimidate, Intuition, or Pokémon Education at Novice Rank
target: A Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point remaining
effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a move from its tutor list marked with a (N), or any move on its level-up list learned at X Level or lower, where X is the target’s current Level plus the sum of your Mentor Skill

name: Moment of Action
effect: Each target gains 1 Temporary Action Point.

name: Enduring Soul
effect: You may add to your Pokémon’s HP stat when they level up, ignoring Base Relation, and you do not need to “correct” Stats due to this inflated HP.

name: Bounce Shot
effect: After hitting its mark or landing, your Poké Ball bounces 3 meters in any direction. You may have your

name: Juggling Show
effect: You may roll an additional Xd6 during the In- troduction Stage of a Contest, where X is half of your

name: Round Trip
effect: You may immediately switch your Pokémon that just performed a Move for another of your Pokémon.

name: Tag In
prerequisites: Round Trip, Expert Acrobatics or Guile
effect: The next Pokémon you send out is treated as if the recalled Pokémon had used Baton Pass on it.

name: Emergency Release
effect: You may Release a Pokémon as an Interrupt.

name: First Blood
prerequisites: Tag In, Master Acrobatics or Guile
trigger: You release a Pokémon from its Poké Ball
effect: If you have a Pokémon turn available this round or next, your Pokémon may use a Move as an Interrupt as soon as it is sent out. This consumes your Pokémon turn for the round (or the following round) as normal.

name: Ramming Speed
target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Run

name: Ride as One
effect: While you are Mounted, you and your Mount each use the highest of each other’s Speed Evasion. If both you and your Mount have the same Speed Evasion, you instead each receive a +1 bonus to Speed Evasion.

name: Taskmaster
trigger: You apply Brutal Training as a Training action
effect: You may grant your Pokémon up to three injuries. If your Pokémon has at least one Injury, it becomes

name: Stat Training
target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
effect: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point, and learns a

name: Stat Maneuver
prerequisites: Stat Ace, Adept Command or Focus
effect: Stat Maneuver’s Effect depends on your Chosen

name: Stat Mastery
effect: Stat Mastery’s Effect depends on your Chosen

name: Style Entrainment
effect: Your Pokémon gains one of the following

name: Move Sync
target: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
effect: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target’s Move List. The picked move is now permanently of your Chosen Type, and may have different effects.

name: Chef
effect: You may use any Chef Recipe for which you qualify.

name: Chronicler
target: A Pokémon, Trainer, Move, or Location.
effect: You make Record of the target. Records can be placed in an Archive as an Extended Action. When you take

name: Targeted Profiling
effect: On the target’s next turn, they act as if they had the Mold Breaker Ability against all Pokémon and

name: Fashionista
prerequisites: Two of Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition at Novice
effect: You may craft any Fashionista Recipe for which you qualify.

name: Natural Fighter
effect: You and your Pokémon become adept at using the environment to your advantage in battle. You or your Pokémon may activate Natural Fighter as a

name: Trapper
effect: You create a consumable item that creates 8 meters of Hazard within 6 meters. All 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of the Hazard.

name: Adaptive Geography
trigger: You or your Pokémon gain Initiative
effect: The triggering target takes their turn as if they were in a terrain adjacent to the terrain they are in on the following graphic. For example, if you are standing in Wetlands terrain, you may act as if you are standing in Forest or Ocean Terrain. This affects Survivalist

name: Training Regime
effect: You gain additional static bonuses based on your

name: Coaching
trigger: Your Pokémon makes a Combat Maneuver
effect: Your Pokémon gains a bonus based on the type of Combat maneuver they are making. This Feature may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon. »»

name: Dance Form
effect: Create and learn two Dance Moves, plus one more for each other Dancer Feature you have. Whenever you gain another Dancer Feature, create and learn another

name: Beguiling Dance
effect: When creating Dance Moves, you can choose to create a Dance Move that has Range: 4, 1 Target, AC 3, and lowers a Combat Stat (chosen at creation) by -2 Combat Stages. This Move is otherwise the same as other Dance Moves you could create except that Dance

name: Dance Practice
target: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
effect: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains your choice of Spinning Dance or Own Tempo. Dance

name: Musical Ability
effect: Choose Drown Out or Soundproof. You gain the chosen Ability.

name: Push Buttons
effect: Your Social Moves’ Frequency is not Expended if they miss. You gain the Demoralize Edge, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. Its effects for Status Moves now trigger on 18+, and Social Moves that activate this “Crit” Range cause their targets to lose a tick of Hit

name: Dirty Fighting
prerequisites: Rogue, a Rogue Skill at Adept Rank
trigger: You hit a foe with Weapon Attack
effect: After the attack is Resolved, you may immediately use the Dirty Trick Maneuver if the target is within range. You automatically hit with Dirty Trick, but must still make an Opposed Roll.

name: Unexpected Attacks
prerequisites: Rogue, two Rogue Skills at Adept Rank
effect: You learn the Moves Pursuit and Sucker Punch.

name: Underhanded Tactics
prerequisites: Rogue, a Rogue Skill at Expert Rank
effect: You gain your choice of Ambush or Cruelty.

name: Menace
trigger: You hit a foe with the Terrorize Manipulation
effect: Until their next turn, the target has their Initiative lowered to 0. For one full round, attacks against them cause them to Flinch on 17+ or have their existing

name: Malice
effect: You learn the Moves Mean Look and Chip Away.

name: Fearsome Display
trigger: You use Leer or a Roughneck Move
effect: The Move gains additional effects. »»

name: Cruel Gaze
effect: You learn the Moves Glare and Headbutt.

name: Tough as Nails
effect: You learn the Moves Endure and Slack Off.

name: Flip Out
effect: Your Tumbler Moves gain additional effects. »»

name: Death From Above
effect: You learn the Moves Acrobatics and Bounce.

name: Quick Reflexes
effect: You gain the Dodge Ability.

name: Burst of Speed
effect: Select an Initiative Count equal to half of your own Initiative or less; you may take an extra turn at that point in the round.

name: Aura Mastery
effect: Choose two of Aura Sphere, Focus Blast, Drain

name: Channeler
effect: You Channel the target Pokémon. If you attempt to Channel a Hostile Pokémon, you must make an Intuition

name: Battle Synchronization
effect: For one full round, whenever a Channeled

name: Utility Drop
effect: You may use a Smoke Ball, Caltrops, or Toxic

name: Weightless Step
effect: You gain the Infiltrator Ability.

name: Kinjutsu
effect: You learn the Moves Substitute and Toxic.

name: Divination
effect: You may perform an Augury or Scrying.

name: Unveiled Sight
effect: You can see through Illusions. This means you can spot Illusions from the Illusionist capability,

name: Small Prophecies
effect: Roll 1d20 and note the result. Until the end of your next turn, you may choose to replace a single d20 roll you or a willing ally makes with the noted result.

name: Mark of Vision
effect: You mark the target with a mystical power which allows you to close your eyes and focus to perceive the world with their senses from their perspective. You may

name: Prescience
trigger: You are hit by an attack
effect: The attack instead misses.

name: Sacred Shield
effect: You learn the Moves Reflect and Lucky Chant.

name: Mystic Defense
effect: You learn the Moves Light Screen and Safeguard.

name: Lay on Hands
effect: Choose Blessed Touch or Healer. You gain the

name: PK Alpha
effect: You learn the Moves Kinesis and Barrier.

name: PK Omega
effect: You learn the Moves Telekinesis and Psychic.

name: Power of the Mind
effect: Choose Interference or Levitate. You gain the chosen Ability.

name: Telekinetic Burst
effect: You perform a Disarm, Trip, or Push Maneuver using your Telekinetic Capability.

name: Honed Mind
effect: You learn the Moves Mind Reader and Calm

name: Telepathic Awareness
effect: Choose Gentle Vibe or Telepathy. You gain the chosen Ability.

name: Thought Detection
effect: You become aware of the number of living

name: Mental Assault
effect: You learn the Moves Extrasensory and Psyshock.

name: Suggestion
prerequisites: Honed Mind, Master Focus or Intuition
effect: You smoothly plant a thought into the subject’s head that lasts as long as this Feature is Bound. They won’t know exactly why or how they thought of it; they will naturally assume they thought of it themselves, and their brain will attempt to get there as logically as it can.

name: Space Distortion
effect: You learn the Moves Teleport and Ally Switch.

name: Warping Ground
effect: You learn the Moves Gravity and Trick.

name: Strange Energy
effect: You learn the Moves Heal Block and Magic Coat.

name: Reality Bender
effect: You are able to subconsciously alter the fabric of reality to change small facts or circumstances. If your character is confronting a “random” event such as a die roll, coin flip, or cards being dealt, the character may activate this Feature to influence the event. In this scenario, the GM provides you with two possible outcomes, and you pick one of them to actually occur.
